Structs/URLPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/URLPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input is a valid URL.

Structs/RequiredPredicate.html#/s:10Pepp.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/RequiredPredicate.html#/s:10Pepp.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input is empty

Structs/RegexPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/RegexPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input matches the regular expression specified by the receiver.

Structs/RangePredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/RangePredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input is inside the given range bounds.

Structs/LengthPredicate.html#/s:10Pepper.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/LengthPredicate.html#/s:10Pepper.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input is inside the given range bounds.

Structs/EmailPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/EmailPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given email is a syntactically valid, according to the RFC 5322 official standard.

Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html#.name: strict
Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html#.abstract: The input’s character set should be a subset of the character set provided at initialisation.

Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html#.name: loose
Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html#.abstract: The input’s character set should intersect with the character set provided at initialisation.

Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html.name: Mode
Structs/CharacterSetPredicate/Mode.html.abstract: The Mode enum is used to set the evaluation mode of the input’s character set against the character set provided at initialisation.

Structs/CharacterSetPredicate.html#/s:10.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/CharacterSetPredicate.html#/s:10.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given Srings contains only characters in the character set.

Structs/BlockPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/BlockPredicate.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input matches the evalutaion closure specified by the receiver.

Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: InputType
Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the predicate can be evaluated with.

Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: init(_:)
Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: Creates a type-erased Predicate that wraps the given instance.

Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/AnyPredicate.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input matches the conditions specified by the receiver.

Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.name: errors
Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.abstract: A non-empty[Error] if the validation result is .failure, empty otherwise.

Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.name: failingConstraints
Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.abstract: The number of failing constraints for a .failure result, 0 otherwise.

Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.name: hasFailingConstraints
Structs/Summary.html#/s:10Peppermint7Sum.abstract: true if the validation result is .failure, false otherwise.

Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: set(for:constraint:)
Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Set a Constraint on a property from the root object.

Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: set(for:constraintBuilder:)
Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Set a Constraint on a property from the root object.

Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.name: evaluate(with:)
Structs/TypeConstraint.html#/s:10Pepperm.abstract: Evaluates the input on the set key path constraints.

Structs/ConditionedConstraint.html#/s:10.name: conditionsCount
Structs/ConditionedConstraint.html#/s:10.abstract: The number of conditions that must be evaluated i

Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.name: count
Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.abstract: Returns the number of constraints in collection

Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.name: init(_:constraints:)
Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.abstract: Create a new AndCompoundConstraint instance populated with a predefined list of Constraints

Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.name: init(_:constraints:)
Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.abstract: Create a new AndCompoundConstraint instance populated with a predefined list of Constraints

Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.name: init(_:constraintBuilder:)
Structs/CompoundConstraint.html#/s:10Pep.abstract: Create a new CompoundConstraint instance populated with a predefined list of Constraints

Structs/BlockConstraint.html#/s:10Pepper.name: init(_:errorBuilder:)
Structs/BlockConstraint.html#/s:10Pepper.abstract: Create a new BlockContraint instance with an underlying BlockPredicate.

Structs/BlockConstraint.html#/s:10Pepper.name: init(_:errorBuilder:)
Structs/BlockConstraint.html#/s:10Pepper.abstract: Create a new BlockContraint instance with an underlying BlockPredicate.

Structs/AnyConstraint.html#/s:10Peppermi.name: InputType
Structs/AnyConstraint.html#/s:10Peppermi.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the constraint can be evaluated with.

Structs/AnyConstraint.html#/s:10Peppermi.name: init(_:)
Structs/AnyConstraint.html#/s:10Peppermi.abstract: Creates a type-erased Constraint that wraps the given instance.

Structs/ConditionedConstraint.html.name: ConditionedConstraint
Structs/ConditionedConstraint.html.abstract: A data type that links a Predicate to an Error that describes why the predicate evaluation has failed.

Structs/PredicateConstraint.html.name: PredicateConstraint
Structs/PredicateConstraint.html.abstract: A data type that links a Predicate to an Error that describes why the predicate evaluation has failed.

Structs/BlockPredicate.html.name: BlockPredicate
Structs/BlockPredicate.html.abstract: The BlockPredicate struct is used to define closure based conditions used to evaluate generic inputs.

Structs/CharacterSetPredicate.html.name: CharacterSetPredicate
Structs/CharacterSetPredicate.html.abstract: The CharacterSetPredicate struct is used to evaluate a String inputs agains a defined CharacterSet.

Structs/EmailPredicate.html.name: EmailPredicate
Structs/EmailPredicate.html.abstract: The EmailPredicate struct is used to evaluate whether a given input is a syntactically valid email address, based on the RFC 5322 official standard.

Structs/LengthPredicate.html.name: LengthPredicate
Structs/LengthPredicate.html.abstract: The LengthPredicate struct is used to evaluate whether a given input is of a given length.

Structs/RangePredicate.html.name: RangePredicate
Structs/RangePredicate.html.abstract: The RangePredicate struct is used to evaluate whether a given input is inside a given range.

Structs/RegexPredicate.html.name: RegexPredicate
Structs/RegexPredicate.html.abstract: The RegexPredicate struct is used to define regluar expression based conditions used to evaluate input strings.

Structs/RequiredPredicate.html.name: RequiredPredicate
Structs/RequiredPredicate.html.abstract: The RequiredPredicate struct is used to evaluate whether a given input is empty.

Structs/URLPredicate.html.name: URLPredicate
Structs/URLPredicate.html.abstract: The URLPredicate struct is used to evaluate whether a given input is a syntactically valid URL.

Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html#/s:10Peppe.name: InputType
Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html#/s:10Peppe.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the predicate can be evaluated with.

Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html#/s:10Peppe.name: evaluate(with:queue:completionHandler:)
Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html#/s:10Peppe.abstract: Asynchronous evaluates whether a given input matches the conditions specified by the receiver, then calls a handler upon completion.

Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.name: InputType
Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the predicate can be evaluated with.

Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.name: evaluate(with:)
Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given input matches the conditions specified by the receiver.

Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.name: erase()
Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.abstract: Wraps this predicate with a type eraser

Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.name: evaluate(with:queue:completionHandler:)
Protocols/Predicate.html#/s:10Peppermint.abstract: Asynchronous evaluates whether a given input matches the conditions specified by the receiver, then calls a handler upon completion.

Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.name: InputType
Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the constraint can be evaluated with.

Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.name: ErrorType
Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.abstract: An error type that provides information about why the evaluation failed.

Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.name: evaluate(with:queue:completionHandler:)
Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html#/s:10Pepp.abstract: Asynchronous evaluates the input on the provided queue.

Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: InputType
Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: A type that provides information about what kind of values the constraint can be evaluated with.

Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: ErrorType
Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: An error type that provides information about why the evaluation failed.

Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: erase()
Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: Wraps this constraint with a type eraser

Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.name: evaluate(with:queue:completionHandler:)
Protocols/Constraint.html#/s:10Peppermin.abstract: Asynchronous evaluates the input against the receiver.

Protocols/Constraint.html.name: Constraint
Protocols/Constraint.html.abstract: The Constraint protocol is used to define the structre that must be implemented by concrete constraints.

Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html.name: AsyncConstraint
Protocols/AsyncConstraint.html.abstract: The AsyncConstraint protocol is used to define the structure that must be implemented by concrete asynchronous constraints.

Protocols/Predicate.html.name: Predicate
Protocols/Predicate.html.abstract: The Predicate protocol is used to define the structre that must be implemented by concrete predicates.

Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html.name: AsyncPredicate
Protocols/AsyncPredicate.html.abstract: The AsyncPredicate protocol is used to define the structre that must be implemented by concrete async predicates.
